bib_record.title: Determination of the D2 parameter for (d,3He) reactions

free_txt: The University of Wisconsin Lamb-shift
polarized ion source
At 9 MeV two telescopes with thin (30 microm)
dE detectors were used while at 12 MeV we used four
counter telescopes with 60 microm thick dE detectors.
The error bars shown in subsequent figures include the
contributions from statistics, from uncertainties in
the background subtraction and from the statistical
uncertainty in the determination of the beam
polarizations.
The University of Wisconsin Lamb-shift
polarized ion source
Reaction products were detected by dE-E counter
telescopes located to one side of the incident beam.

normalization estimated to be 10%.

The uncertainty in the overall
normalization estimated to be 10%.
To obtain absolute cross sections, an optical-model
calculation was used to determine the elastic
scattering cross section at the monitor detector angle.
This procedure is reasonably accurate since the monitor
cross section differs only slightly (i.e. by about 2%
at Ed = 9 MeV and 12% at Ed = 12 MeV) from Rutherford.
